trigger: In vivo inhibition of NF-kappa B in T-lineage cells leads to a dramatic decrease in cell proliferation and cytokine production and to increased cell apoptosis in response to mitogenic stimuli , but not to abnormal thymopoiesis .

In vivo inhibition of NF-kappa B in T-lineage cells leads to a dramatic decrease in cell proliferation and cytokine production and to increased cell apoptosis in response to mitogenic stimuli , but not to abnormal thymopoiesis .

These results point out the involvement of NF-kappa B / Rel family proteins in growth signaling pathways by either regulating proteins involved in the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling or by functionally interfering with the cell cycle progression .
